title: Manhole fires on Newbury Street prompt building and street evacuations
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Six manholes exploded on Newbury Street, causing evacuations from Gloucester to Dartmouth Street in Boston.
The explosions led to street closures on Newbury, Exeter, and Dartmouth Streets with no reported injuries.
The manhole fires, attributed to an electrical issue, were attended by Boston Police and Fire Departments.

title: South Station’s new fare gates still out of service more than a week after snow storm
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: South Station's new fare gates have been non-operational since a major snowstorm hit Boston over a week ago.
The gates, costing $1.3 million to purchase and $2 million to install, were wrapped and shut down before heavy snow.
Keolis and Scheidt & Bachmann are assessing snow impact on gates for swift restoration, MBTA spokesperson reports.

title: Devin McCourty on ’25 Patriots: ‘A lot different than us’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Devin McCourty praises the 2025 Patriots' mentality, stating they can compete with any team in the NFL.
Mike Vrabel, Patriots' head coach, focuses on building a new program, contrasting past dynasty expectations.
McCourty reflects on differences between past championship teams and current roster dynamics under Vrabel.

title: Woman who posed as student at Boston high schools accepts plea deal, sentenced to probation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Shelby Hewitt, 34, posed as a student at three Boston high schools during 2022-2023, pleading guilty to multiple charges.
Hewitt received a four-year probation sentence and must pay over $9,000 in restitution, avoiding Boston Public Schools.
The former social worker used aliases and created fake documents, violating public employee conduct standards.

title: BPS pauses new hiring amid deficit as district predicts hundreds of layoffs next year
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston Public Schools announced a partial hiring freeze due to a projected $53 million budget deficit this fiscal year.
The School Committee voted to close three schools by 2027, potentially affecting 300 to 400 educator jobs.
Superintendent Mary Skipper cited rising costs and enrollment declines as factors contributing to financial challenges.

title: From SNL-style ‘Weekend Updates’ to a TD Garden beer chug, Will Campbell isn’t afraid to bring the laughs
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Will Campbell entertains Patriots with comedic 'Weekend Updates' recaps of weekly practices.
Campbell gained attention by chugging beer and flexing shirtless at a Celtics game.
Despite early struggles and an MCL sprain, Campbell bolstered the Patriots' offensive line.

title: Police searching for Dorchester girl missing since Thursday
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Boston police are searching for Mela Rosario, 17, missing from Dorchester since Thursday night.
Rosario was last seen near Brockton courthouse after a scheduled appearance in family court.
Rosario is 5’1”, with brown skin and hair, last seen in a pink jacket and black leggings.

title: Devin McCourty explains ‘travesty’ following Belichick, Kraft Hall-of-Fame snubs
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick and Robert Kraft were not selected for the Pro Football Hall of Fame Class of 2026.
Devin McCourty criticized the Hall of Fame voting process, calling the omission of Belichick and Kraft a 'travesty'.
McCourty believes Belichick and Kraft's absence will overshadow the 2026 Hall of Fame induction celebrations.

title: Celtics reportedly trade Anfernee Simons to Bulls, acquire Nikola Vučević
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Celtics trade Anfernee Simons and a second-round pick to the Bulls for Nikola Vučević and a second-round pick.
Simons had a $27.7 million salary, while Vučević's is $21.5 million, reducing Boston's luxury tax penalty.
Vučević averaged 16.9 points and 9 rebounds this season, enhancing Boston's frontcourt led by Neemias Queta and Luka Garza.

title: What Mike Vrabel said of Robert Kraft’s latest snub from Pro Football Hall of Fame
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots owner Robert Kraft not voted into the 2026 Pro Football Hall of Fame class.
Mike Vrabel expressed support for Kraft, stating he's "more than deserving" of Hall of Fame recognition.
Under Kraft, the Patriots have won six Super Bowls and reached the playoffs 23 times in 32 years.
